parts.text:
```json
{
"application": "GrADS",
"other_software": [
"wgrib",
"wgrib2",
"alt_gmp",
"NDATE",
"scp",
"qsub",
"bash"
],
"resource_requirements": [
"module use /apps/test/lmodules/core/",
"module load GrADS/2.2.2",
"module load prod_util",
"module load prod_envir",
"module load grib_util",
"export GAUDPT=/apps/test/grads/spack/opt/spack/cray-sles15-zen2/gcc-11.2.0/grads-2.2.2-wckmyzg7qh5smosf6och6ehqtqlxoy4f/data/udpt",
"export GADDIR=/apps/test/grads/spack/opt/spack/cray-sles15-zen2/gcc-11.2.0/grads-2.2.2-wckmyzg7qh5smosf6och6ehqtqlxoy4f/data",
"wgrib=/apps/ops/prod/libs/intel/19.1.3.304/grib_util/1.2.2/bin/wgrib",
"wgrib2=/apps/ops/prod/libs/intel/19.1.3.304/wgrib2/2.0.8/bin/wgrib2",
"/lfs/h2/emc/physics/noscrub/${USER}/plot/cmaq",
"/lfs/h2/emc/stmp/${USER}/com2_aqm_${plotexp}_pm_max.${NOW}${cych}",
"/lfs/h2/emc/stmp/${USER}/daily_plot_${mfileid}_max/aqm_${plotexp}_pm",
"/lfs/h1/ops/${exp}/com/aqm/v6.1/cs.${NOW}",
"/lfs/h2/emc/physics/noscrub/${USER}/com/aqm/${exp}/cs.${NOW}",
"/lfs/h2/emc/ptmp/${USER}/com/aqm/${exp}/cs.${NOW}",
"/lfs/h2/emc/ptmp/jianping.huang/para/com/aqm/v7.0/aqm.v7.0.a1/${NOW}${cyc_in}",
"/lfs/h2/emc/ptmp/jianping.huang/para/com/aqm/v7.0/aqm.v7.0.b1/${NOW}${cyc_in}",
"/lfs/h2/emc/ptmp/jianping.huang/para/com/aqm/v7.0/aqm.v7.0.c1/${NOW}${cyc_in}",
"/lfs/h2/emc/physics/noscrub/${USER}/verification/aqm/${exp}/cs.${NOW}",
"/home/people/emc/www/htdocs/mmb/hchuang/web/fig",
"/naqfc/save/${USER}/WEB/base",
"/lfs/h2/emc/stmp/${USER}/job_submit",
"/lfs/h2/emc/ptmp/${USER}/batch_logs"
]
}
```

This script uses the GrADS software to generate plots of PM2.5 data from CMAQ simulations. It requires various modules to be loaded including GrADS, prod_util, prod_envir, and grib_util. The script also utilizes various other software tools like wgrib, wgrib2, alt_gmp, NDATE, scp, qsub, and bash for different functionalities. 

It utilizes specific directory paths on the system for input data, temporary storage, output plots, and batch job submission. The script further defines variables for different regions, data types, and file identifiers, showcasing its specific use case for CMAQ PM2.5 data analysis.
